metadata.title: CVE-2022-49033 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:btrfs: qgroup: fix sleep from invalid context bug in btrfs_qgroup_inherit()Syzkaller reported BUG as follows:  BUG: sleeping function called from invalid context at       include/linux/sched/mm.h:274  Call Trace:   <TASK>   dump_stack_lvl+0xcd/0x134   __might_resched.cold+0x222/0x26b   kmem_cache_alloc+0x2e7/0x3c0   update_qgroup_limit_item+0xe1/0x390   btrfs_qgroup_inherit+0x147b/0x1ee0   create_subvol+0x4eb/0x1710   btrfs_mksubvol+0xfe5/0x13f0   __btrfs_ioctl_snap_create+0x2b0/0x430   btrfs_ioctl_snap_create_v2+0x25a/0x520   btrfs_ioctl+0x2a1c/0x5ce0   __x64_sys_ioctl+0x193/0x200   do_syscall_64+0x35/0x80Fix this by calling qgroup_dirty() on @dstqgroup, and update limit item inbtrfs_run_qgroups() later outside of the spinlock context.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-49033` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-generic - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-206-lowlatency - 4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1151-aws - 4.15.0-1151.164~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1146-gcp - 4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1115-oracle - 4.15.0-1115.126~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-206.217~16.04.1').
linux-kvm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').

linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1151.164~16.04.1').

linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1146.162~16.04.1').

linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
